Oishani Sengupta is an assistant professor of English at the University of Texas at El Paso. Her work explores the role of colonial visual print culture in shaping race-making in the transatlantic and Indian Ocean worlds. Her work has appeared in Criticism and Verge: Studies in Global Asias, and Modernism/modernity Print+. Her first book tentatively titled Dark Empire: Racializing Africa in Indian Ocean Print Cultures is currently in progress and directly related to the work reproduced in this cluster.
